com.datastax.oss.driver.api.core.metadata

Interface TokenMap


  • public interface TokenMap
    Utility component to work with the tokens of a given driver instance.

    Note that the methods that take a keyspace argument are based on schema metadata, which can be disabled or restricted to a subset of keyspaces; therefore these methods might return empty results for some or all of the keyspaces.

    See Also:
    DefaultDriverOption.METADATA_SCHEMA_ENABLED, Session.setSchemaMetadataEnabled(Boolean), DefaultDriverOption.METADATA_SCHEMA_REFRESHED_KEYSPACES

      • newToken

        @NonNull
Token newToken(@Nullable
                        Partitioner partitioner,
                        @NonNull
                        ByteBuffer... partitionKey)
        Builds a token from a partition key.
        Parameters:
        partitioner - the partitioner to use or null for this TokenMap's partitioner.
        partitionKey - the partition key components, in their serialized form (which can be obtained with TypeCodec.encode(Object, ProtocolVersion). Neither the individual components, nor the vararg array itself, can be null.

      • getTokens

        @NonNull
default Set<Token> getTokens(@NonNull
                                      Node node)
        The tokens owned by the given node.

        This is functionally equivalent to getTokenRanges(node).map(r -> r.getEnd()). Note that the set is rebuilt every time you call this method.

      • getTokenRanges

      • getReplicas

        @NonNull
default Set<Node> getReplicas(@NonNull
                                       String keyspaceName,
                                       @NonNull
                                       Token token)
        Shortcut for getReplicas(CqlIdentifier.fromCql(keyspaceName), token).

      • getReplicas

        @NonNull
default Set<Node> getReplicas(@NonNull
                                       CqlIdentifier keyspace,
                                       @NonNull
                                       TokenRange range)
        The replicas for a given range in the given keyspace.

        It is assumed that the input range does not overlap across multiple node ranges. If the range extends over multiple nodes, it only returns the nodes that are replicas for the last token of the range. In other words, this method is a shortcut for getReplicas(keyspace, range.getEnd()).

      • getReplicas

        @NonNull
default Set<Node> getReplicas(@NonNull
                                       String keyspaceName,
                                       @NonNull
                                       TokenRange range)
        Shortcut for getReplicas(CqlIdentifier.fromCql(keyspaceName), range).

      • getPartitionerName

        @NonNull
String getPartitionerName()
        The name of the partitioner class in use, as reported by the Cassandra nodes.
